hero.title: We'll Help You Navigate
hero.description: Insurance paperwork is confusing, frustrating, and sometimes feels designed to make you give up. We won't let that happen. We'll help you get the coverage your family deserves.

honestTalk.title: Let's Be Honest About Insurance
paragraphs: Dealing with insurance for home health care is a nightmare. The denials, the prior authorizations, the endless phone calls, the forms that ask the same questions seventeen different ways—it's exhausting.

You're already managing your loved one's medical needs, coordinating appointments, and trying to keep your family functioning. The last thing you need is to become an expert in insurance billing codes.
That's where we come in. We've been doing this for years, and we know how to get approvals, fight denials, and navigate the system. You shouldn't have to do this alone.

insurancePrograms.title: Insurance Programs We Accept
insurancePrograms.subtitle: We work with GAPP, Medicare, Medicaid, and Waiver Programs like CCSP and SOURCE to provide skilled nursing care with no out-of-pocket costs for qualified families.

programs.name: GAPP
programs.description: A Medicaid program providing private home care for disabled children ages 5-21 who qualify for skilled and non-skilled home care.

programs.name: Medicare
programs.description: We accept Medicare for eligible children with qualifying disabilities who meet federal coverage requirements.

programs.name: Medicaid
programs.description: We work with Georgia Medicaid to provide comprehensive home health services for all ages with no out-of-pocket costs.

programs.name: CCSP / SOURCE
programs.description: We accept Community Care Services Program (CCSP) and Service Options Using Resources in a Community Environment (SOURCE) for eligible elderly and disabled individuals.

howWeHelp.title: We Handle the Paperwork
howWeHelp.subtitle: How We Help You Navigate Insurance

steps.title: We Check Your Eligibility
steps.description: Not sure if your loved one qualifies? We'll review your situation and let you know which programs you're eligible for. No guessing, no wasted applications.

steps.title: We Complete the Applications
steps.description: Those 47-page application forms? We'll help you fill them out correctly the first time. We know exactly what documentation is needed and how to present the needs in a way that gets approved.

steps.title: We Fight Denials
steps.description: Got denied? Don't panic. We know how to appeal, what documentation to submit, and how to get decisions overturned. We've done this hundreds of times.

steps.title: We Handle All Billing
steps.description: You'll never see a bill from us. We bill insurance directly, handle all the paperwork, and deal with any billing issues. Your job is to focus on your loved one—not on medical bills.

steps.title: We Keep Your Coverage Active
steps.description: Renewals, recertifications, updated care plans—we track all the deadlines and make sure your coverage doesn't lapse. You have enough to remember without adding insurance renewal dates to the list.

questions.question: What if my loved one doesn't qualify for GAPP, Medicare, or Medicaid?
questions.answer: Let's talk. There are other programs and options we can explore, like CCSP or SOURCE. We'll help you find a way to get the care needed, even if it means connecting you with other resources.

questions.question: How long does the approval process take?
questions.answer: It varies, but typically 2-6 weeks for initial applications. If care is needed urgently, let us know—we can sometimes expedite the process or arrange temporary coverage while we wait for approval.

questions.question: What if I've been denied before?
questions.answer: Denials happen all the time—often because the application wasn't filled out correctly or didn't include the right documentation. Let us review your case. We might be able to appeal the denial or reapply with better supporting information.

questions.question: Will I really have zero out-of-pocket costs?
questions.answer: For qualified families with GAPP, Medicare, or Medicaid coverage—yes, absolutely zero. We bill insurance directly, and you won't receive any bills from us. If there are any coverage issues, we'll work them out with the insurance company, not with you.

cta.title: Let's Figure Out Your Insurance Together
cta.description: Call us and we'll walk you through your options. We'll check eligibility, explain the process, and help you get started. No confusing jargon, no pressure—just honest help.
